captions.text:
Don't do that! That wouldn't
be PROFITABLE...for anyone.

-No one likes me.
-I'm sure plenty of people like you!

-My wife doesn't.
-Aw, Susan?! She loves you!

-How do you know my wife?
-I don't.
Susan is just a very common name, Khyan.

We just met!
I shall call you 'Ledge Man'! Mmm!
Are you here to kill me?

-Well, I'm gonna kill myself.
-No no no no no!
Okay. Here's what you're gonna do.

You're gonna go home,
grab your wife and say, "Susan!

"I am a man and
I deserve some respect!"

And "How DARE you take out
a sizeable life insurance plan on me,

"and hire a contract killer
to shoot me at my place of work?!"

You know, for a hit man,
you're alright.

That's some good advice.
I'm gonna take it!

comments.author: Grakniir

comments.text:
plot twist! Kyan's wife saw what happened, and ran at him with a knife, 
since she thought the assassin double crossed her. As it turned out, the 
assassin saw that, and had a stroke of genius. He shot the wife, she 
screamed in agony before she died, and Juan saw what happened. As a token 
of his thanks, for saving his life, Kyan later paid the assassin what he 
was going to receive for killing him, to make up for his trouble, and also 
a little extra for saving his life.﻿

comments.author: Lapis Murlock

comments.text:
+Lapis Murlock Sorry, what? I think that if we make a story "Public" it is 
for people to create more story, we can add what we think that is better 
for the story. If we want it to be funny, we can add funny things, if we 
want it to be a serious story about love and life, we can. I intended to do 
a "Serious" story with a bizarre atmosphere. I mean, you dont see an 
exsoldier from a country that doesnt exist now being patriotic AND INVOKING 
FUCKING CTHULHU FOR OIL everyday. And my level of english is not advanced 
enough to understand what you said about the sense of perspective. If you 
want to make a "Public" story with rules, then make a forum about it or at 
least say the rules at start, that feets more. I didnt want to effend you 
is thats what happened, but c`mon, we were all great, lets not discuss for 
stupid reasons. BTW is +Wargasm336 still alive? Because Cthulhu only took a 
nap compared with him XD just joking, but i miss he`s/she`s plot twists.
comments.author: ariel sharpe

comments.text:
...I think that story was not even made to make sense or be interesting, 
just to be random, and as sarcasam for something I did. I'm not intending 
toreference ANY plots. Also, who said that the dark magic was actually 
corrupting? It was a mistake that he had them anyways. He just has a great 
power, that tends to be best for evil things and comes from evil things, 
but he attempts to use them for good. geez. No sense of perspective.
comments.author: Lapis Murlock

comments.text:
+Lapis Murlock Good chapter, good chapter... Now, for the story: WARNING, 
THIS IS A LOT, BUT MOST OF IT ARE DETAILS AND DESCRIPTIONS TO MAKE THE 
STORY MORE CLEAR.
Abtitus literally became an object in the eyes of the brothers and the 
other Assassins (BTW, now the story sounds like FC4, two assholes that you 
help and the "Bad guy" that is actually good. Lets just add a dance battle 
and hackers and we have "Ubisoft and the adventure of the brothers"), a 
powerful object, that can be used for the gods, or for the god, or for a 
greater but unknow objective, the answer change when you ask a diferent 
faction. He was locked, and many times he tried to escape, but all hes plan 
ended in the same place: Dark magick. He didnt want to use magick, because 
while more magick he used, darker hes hearts get. But meanwhile, an emperor 
is planing the attack: The imperial court of the Naraani race AKA aliens 
was literally a snakepìt. Mostly because the aliens are snake-like 
creatures, with scales, poison in their sharp fangs and an exceptional 
ability for intrigue, as they fancy that they are the only race capable of 
using the %100 of their minds. "Or at least thats what they say. But the 
eagle always hunts the snake!" Thought Ken. He was a soldier of Murica sent 
to explore space to find oil, but in his travels he found more, like 
planets, planets with life, planets with enslaved life, the slavers, or the 
Naraani as they call themselves, and, ehhh, who the hell wrote this script? 
Whathever, he also found White magick... Yes... I ran out of ideas... But 
lets continue: hes ship was destroyed by a giant ship of the naraani, but 
he surviverd the impact thanks to, well, he says that he survived thanks to 
the power of patriotism, liberty and capitalism, but he actually survived 
thanks to the scape pods, se now he is hiding in a cave, trying to kill the 
emperor, or as the aliens say, "The illuminatum maximus" (YES, ILLUMINATIS 
FROM SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE!!!!!!!), but the emperor, called Regenaton 
always managed to avoid the traps, the rebels, the sabotage, the poison 
(Well, he didnt avoid that, but you know, he is a super snake...), even 
magick, but this time he was sure that he would kill that sneaky (Or should 
i say... SNAKY! HA! Because he is a snake, and... forget it) bitch, he 
would contact with great leaders that would help him to onquer that planet 
and the precious oil, "Surely those great leaders are Washington, Lincoln, 
and all the fathers!", he thought. 
He was wrong. 
White magick is only white, but nothing change with dark magick.
Imagine trying to see a 4D square, but seeing all of it dimensions and 
views.
Imagine the mix of a triangle and a circle.
Thats what Ken saw when he invocated the great leaders and descended to 
madness.
That was what Ken saw when he stopped the eternal sleep.
Thats what Ken saw when he did what cults couldnt make in ages.
That what Ken saw when he invoked Cthulhu.
comments.author: ariel sharpe

comments.text:
Meanwhile, the boy, whos name i've decided is Abtitus, the latin word for 
secret, is consumed with thoughts of home, of his loving mother and his 
father Kyan. He realizes the issue about being who he is in this world, and 
also another thing. Up until that point, he had been hiding his dark 
powers, as he knew that the second he did, everyone would attempt to use 
them for the worst. A very intelligent assumption, considering everyone 
around him was an assassin. So, after learning the skills of the assassin, 
he used his powers to vanish from their grasp, and sent himself far away. 
Unfortunately, he reappeared in quite possibly the most inconvenient place 
possible. He appeared right between the two brothers, right as they were in 
the middle of their arguments. Instantly, one brother took the obviously 
magical and dark event as a sign of his right to rule, and a powerful tool 
to help him do so, while the other brother took it as a gift from the dark 
gods to help him carry out their will. Abtitus' worst fears were confirmed. 
He had only made things worse, and now, unless he did something, he would 
be sought after for the rest of his life.
comments.author: Lapis Murlock

comments.text:
+Lapis Murlock Satisfied, yes, but did i made the characters for nothing? 
Ooooooohhh, ok, i continue, but maybe i didnt understand a part of the 
story, in that case, tell me:
Kyan tried to train the boy to become part of The order, but the boy only 
became more and more ambitious (Because obviusly creating a link between 
worlds isnt ambitious) and paranoid, because to fully understand the void, 
one must be absorbed by it. Meanwhile, in the base of the brothers, they 
started recruiting prisoners of the last war against the Order, because, 
well, they were only seven, and they knew that soon the aliens would come 
back. But, even with all the problems they lived, ancient problems between 
the brothers such as envy and being selfish slowly made them hate each 
other again, and another schism was too close, while one was reckless, the 
other was slow, while one wanted to discover ancient secrets of the 
universe, the other think that some things must be lost for mortals, while 
one believe that he is a god, the other zealously believe in ancient gods, 
gods that might someday return for the  control of the earth, while the 
servants of the "godly" assassin make sacrifices for the great assassin and 
god of death, the helpers of the other assassin sing in the night:
Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn.
I also made a lot XD
comments.author: ariel sharpe

comments.text: No, no, no! Kyan and the assassin fall in love and live happily ever after.
comments.author: notanimposter

comments.text:
sure. Just let me see if I can catch up...
OK. So, in the final battle between kyan's children and Kyan's order, The 
children Fight in and on, until they finnaly bring thier father to his 
knees. But unexpectadly, the instant Kyan finds himself cornered, he brings 
out a smalll device., based off the technology of the time before. It's 
purpose is to let a person travel between alternate timelines and parralel 
universes. He attempts to use this technology to leave the current 
timeline, then reenter it in the optimal position to land the killing blow 
on his children. Unknown to him, The diagrams for the device were not fully 
functional, and it was only a prototype. As such, when Kyan opened the 
portal to the parralel universe, he ended up opening a short, 
tri-dimensional portal that only worked one way. Towards thiers. Meanwhile, 
in the furthest parralel universe, were dark magics are a fundemental 
mechanic of the universe, a boy is reaserching the realm of the void, a 
realm of eldritch knowledge and sinister beasts. He finnalises the attempt 
at a ritual to create a link to it, for the search of knowladge, and for 
fun. It normally wouldn't have worked, but kyan made it do exactly that. 
The boy was suddenly sent to the realm, and upon entering, absorbed the 
powerful forces within. However, he was quickly swept out, and sent to 
kyans worl, landing himself in quite a predicament.

That was WAY to much, but is one heck of a turn of events. Satisfied?
comments.author: Lapis Murlock

comments.text:
A little backstory for people with questions about this video. Here we meet 
Assassin, who has been hired by Susan, (Ledge Man's wife) to kill her 
husband after setting a reasonable lifeinsurance on him. This kill is 
suposed to happen close to were Ledgeman Man works, so that the 
lifeinsurance counts. But Ledge Man had plans on killing himself by jumping 
of a rooftop. Here he meets Assassin, who is betting ready for shooting 
Ledge Man. Assassin manages to say all this by accident to his target 
(Ledge Man) but it doesn't seem like Ledge Man noticed, and with a little 
preptalk with him, he decides to not peform sucie after all, and goes of 
the rooftop. As he does so, he is (most likely) close to his workingplace, 
where all accidents conserning Ledge Man will be repayed to his familly. 
Assassin sends a lethal shot to Ledge Man, and get's payed for his work.﻿
